stations.name: 12th Street/Oakland City Center
stations.description: 12th Street is a major transfer station in downtown Oakland, serving as a hub for multiple BART lines and AC Transit buses.

stations.name: 16th Street Mission
stations.description: 16th Street Mission serves San Francisco's vibrant Mission District, known for its Latino culture, murals, and restaurants.

stations.name: 19th Street/Oakland
stations.description: 19th Street serves the Uptown and Lake Merritt neighborhoods of Oakland, near the Paramount Theatre and Fox Oakland Theatre.

stations.name: 24th Street Mission
stations.description: 24th Street Mission is the southern end of BART service in the Mission District, near the historic Balmy Alley murals.

stations.name: Antioch
stations.description: Antioch is the eastern terminus of the Yellow Line, served by eBART diesel trains connecting to electric BART at Pittsburg/Bay Point.

stations.name: Ashby
stations.description: Ashby station serves South Berkeley and is home to one of the Bay Area's largest weekend flea markets in its parking lot.

stations.name: Balboa Park
stations.description: Balboa Park is a major transfer point between BART and Muni Metro, with adjacent bus connections and a park-and-ride facility.

stations.name: Bay Fair
stations.description: Bay Fair is a junction station where the Dublin/Pleasanton and Fremont lines diverge, named after the nearby Bayfair Center mall.

stations.name: Berryessa/North San Jose
stations.description: Berryessa is the current southern terminus of BART's Silicon Valley extension, with plans to extend further to downtown San Jose.

stations.name: Castro Valley
stations.description: Castro Valley station serves the unincorporated community of Castro Valley in the East Bay hills.

stations.name: Civic Center/UN Plaza
stations.description: This station serves San Francisco's Civic Center, City Hall, and numerous government buildings.

entrances.name: A3 1150 Market Street - UN Plaza Stairs

stations.name: Coliseum
stations.description: Coliseum station serves the Oakland Coliseum complex and provides connections to the Oakland Airport via the Oakland Airport Connector.

entrances.name: Elevated Walkway to Amtrak Station, Coliseum Arena

stations.name: Colma
stations.description: Colma station serves the town of Colma and nearby shopping centers, with large park-and-ride facilities.

stations.name: Concord
stations.description: Concord station serves the city of Concord with extensive parking and bus connections to surrounding communities.

stations.name: Daly City
stations.address: 500 John Daly Blvd, Daly City, CA 94014
stations.description: Daly City is the terminus for Blue and Green lines and a major transfer point, with extensive parking facilities serving commuters from the Peninsula.

entrances.name: A John Daly, Junipero Serra Blvd
B De Long St, St Charles Ave

stations.name: Downtown Berkeley
stations.description: Downtown Berkeley station serves the city's vibrant downtown area and the University of California, Berkeley campus.

stations.name: Dublin/Pleasanton
stations.description: Dublin/Pleasanton is the eastern terminus of the Blue Line with extensive parking and connections to ACE commuter rail.

stations.name: El Cerrito del Norte
stations.description: El Cerrito del Norte is a major bus transfer point with extensive parking, serving as a gateway for riders from western Contra Costa County.

stations.name: El Cerrito Plaza
stations.description: El Cerrito Plaza station is adjacent to the El Cerrito Plaza shopping center and serves central El Cerrito.

stations.name: Embarcadero
stations.description: Embarcadero is a major transit hub in San Francisco's Financial District, adjacent to the Ferry Building and providing connections to Muni Metro and buses.

stations.name: Fremont
stations.description: Fremont station is a major transit hub in the southern East Bay, with extensive park-and-ride facilities.

stations.name: Fruitvale
stations.description: Fruitvale station is known for its award-winning transit village development and serves the diverse Fruitvale neighborhood.

stations.name: Glen Park
stations.description: Glen Park station serves the Glen Park neighborhood and is the last underground station before BART emerges to the surface heading south.

stations.name: Hayward
stations.description: Hayward station serves downtown Hayward and is a major bus transfer point for AC Transit routes serving the East Bay.

stations.name: Lafayette
stations.description: Lafayette station serves the suburban community of Lafayette with extensive park-and-ride facilities in the Lamorinda area.

stations.name: Lake Merritt
stations.description: Lake Merritt station serves Oakland's Chinatown, the Oakland Museum of California, and the scenic Lake Merritt area.

entrances.name: B1 NW 8th & Oak St Jack London Sq

stations.name: MacArthur
stations.description: MacArthur is a major transfer station where the Richmond and Pittsburg/Bay Point lines diverge, with transit-oriented development nearby.

stations.name: Millbrae
stations.description: Millbrae is an intermodal station providing connections to Caltrain commuter rail service to San Jose and the Peninsula.

stations.name: Milpitas
stations.description: Milpitas station is part of BART's Silicon Valley extension, providing connections to VTA light rail and bus services.

stations.name: Montgomery Street
stations.description: Montgomery Street station serves the heart of San Francisco's Financial District and provides connections to Muni Metro.

stations.name: North Berkeley
stations.description: North Berkeley station serves the residential neighborhoods of northern Berkeley with substantial park-and-ride facilities.

stations.name: North Concord/Martinez
stations.description: North Concord/Martinez station serves northern Concord and provides the closest BART access for Martinez residents.

stations.name: Oakland International Airport
stations.description: Oakland Airport station is the terminus of the automated Oakland Airport Connector, providing direct service to both airport terminals.

stations.name: Orinda
stations.description: Orinda station serves the affluent Lamorinda communities and is the first station after the Berkeley Hills tunnel heading east.

stations.name: Pittsburg Center
stations.description: Pittsburg Center is part of the eBART diesel multiple unit extension, serving downtown Pittsburg.

stations.name: Pittsburg/Bay Point
stations.description: Pittsburg/Bay Point station serves eastern Contra Costa County with massive parking facilities and is the transfer point to eBART.

stations.name: Pleasant Hill/Contra Costa Centre
stations.description: Pleasant Hill station is surrounded by transit-oriented development and serves as a hub for central Contra Costa County commuters.

stations.name: Powell Street
stations.description: Powell Street is one of the busiest stations in the system, serving Union Square and providing connections to the famous San Francisco cable cars.

stations.name: Richmond
stations.description: Richmond is the northern terminus of the Red and Orange lines, providing connections to Amtrak Capitol Corridor service.

stations.name: Rockridge
stations.description: Rockridge station serves the upscale Rockridge neighborhood of Oakland, known for its restaurants and boutique shopping along College Avenue.

stations.name: San Bruno
stations.description: San Bruno station is a junction point where trains split between the SFO Airport branch and the Millbrae mainline.

stations.name: San Francisco International Airport
stations.address: SFO International Terminal, San Francisco, CA 94128
stations.description: SFO Airport station provides direct rail access to San Francisco International Airport, the busiest airport in Northern California.

stations.name: San Leandro
stations.address: 1401 San Leandro Blvd, San Leandro, CA 94577
stations.description: San Leandro station serves downtown San Leandro and the surrounding residential areas with extensive parking.

stations.name: South Hayward
stations.description: South Hayward station serves southern Hayward and Union City residents with substantial park-and-ride facilities.

stations.name: South San Francisco
stations.address: 1333 Mission Rd, South San Francisco, CA 94080
stations.description: South San Francisco station serves the biotech corridor and provides access to the industrial heart of South San Francisco.

stations.name: Union City
stations.description: Union City station is an intermodal hub with connections to the Altamont Corridor Express (ACE) commuter rail to the Central Valley.

stations.name: Walnut Creek
stations.address: 200 Ygnacio Valley Rd, Walnut Creek, CA 94596
stations.description: Walnut Creek station serves the major commercial center of central Contra Costa County with large parking structures.

stations.name: Warm Springs/South Fremont
stations.description: Warm Springs station serves southern Fremont and the growing tech employment centers near Tesla's factory.

stations.name: West Dublin/Pleasanton
stations.description: West Dublin/Pleasanton station serves the commercial and residential growth areas between Dublin and Pleasanton.

stations.name: West Oakland
stations.description: West Oakland station is a key connection point for Transbay service, where trains heading to San Francisco converge before crossing the bay.
